definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out

sentences.english: The boy glowered at the stranger.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩气呼呼地看着陌生人。

sentences.english: Hippo immediately went to "Xuegao" and angrily accused him of stealing the painting.
sentences.chinese: 河马立刻找到了“雪糕”，气呼呼的指责他偷了画。

sentences.english: I bike throwing, huff went away.
sentences.chinese: 我把自行车一丢，气呼呼的走了。

sentences.english: When I feel angry, I don't have to stay angry.
sentences.chinese: 生气的时候，我不用一直气呼呼的。

sentences.english: The child remained under the table in a temper until his father came home.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子在他父亲回家之前一直气呼呼地呆在桌子底下。

sentences.english: Furiously he tested the spark-plugs, stared at the commutator .
sentences.chinese: 他气呼呼地测试着火花塞，眼睛盯着转换器。

sentences.english: He huffed and puffed after her .

definition: variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
